errors.error_description: The installation command `pip install meerkat` is incorrect. The package on PyPI is named `meerkat-ml`, so this command will fail.
The demo command `mk demo image-gallery-tutorial --copy` uses an incorrect demo name, which does not exist.
The README incorrectly suggests that a GPU-enabled PyTorch installation is a mandatory prerequisite for all users, which is not true.
correction_candidates: Change the text to: '> **_GPU Install (Optional)_**: If you want to use Meerkat with a GPU...'
Remove the GPU installation note entirely.
Move the `pip install meerkat-ml` command before the GPU note.
Comment out the GPU install note using <!-- ... -->.
errors.golden_answer: Change the text to: '> **_GPU Install (Optional)_**: If you want to use Meerkat with a GPU...'

errors.error_description: The `pip install` command uses an underscore (`meerkat_ml`) instead of a hyphen (`meerkat-ml`), which will fail as the package name on PyPI is `meerkat-ml`.
The README incorrectly states that `torchaudio` and the non-existent `torchvideo` are mandatory dependencies for basic use, when they are optional dependencies for specific data types.
correction_candidates: Correct the text to: '> **_Optional Dependencies_**: some parts of Meerkat rely on optional dependencies e.g. audio processing may rely on utilities from `torchaudio`.'
Revert the section to its original commented-out state using <!-- ... -->.
Correct the packages to `torchaudio` and `torchvision` and clarify they are optional extras.
errors.golden_answer: Correct the text to: '> **_Optional Dependencies_**: some parts of Meerkat rely on optional dependencies e.g. audio processing may rely on utilities from `torchaudio`.'
